vmMIB.name: vmMIB

revisions.description: The initial version of this MIB, published as RFC 7666.

vmMIB.organization: IETF Operations and Management Area Working Group
vmMIB.contactinfo: WG Email: opsawg@ietf.org Mailing list subscription info: https://www.ietf.org/mailman/listinfo/opsawg Hirochika Asai The University of Tokyo 7-3-1 Hongo Bunkyo-ku, Tokyo 113-8656 Japan Phone: +81 3 5841 6748 Email: panda@hongo.wide.ad.jp Michael MacFaden VMware Inc. Email: mrm@vmware.com Juergen Schoenwaelder Jacobs University Campus Ring 1 Bremen 28759 Germany Email: j.schoenwaelder@jacobs-university.de Keiichi Shima IIJ Innovation Institute Inc. 3-13 Kanda-Nishikicho Chiyoda-ku, Tokyo 101-0054 Japan Email: keiichi@iijlab.net Tina Tsou Huawei Technologies (USA) 2330 Central Expressway Santa Clara, CA 95050 United States Email: tina.tsou.zouting@huawei.com
vmMIB.description: This MIB module is for use in managing a hypervisor and virtual machines controlled by the hypervisor. Copyright (c) 2015 IETF Trust and the persons identified as authors of the code. All rights reserved. Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification, is permitted pursuant to, and subject to the license terms contained in, the Simplified BSD License set forth in Section 4.c of the IETF Trust's Legal Provisions Relating to IETF Documents (http://trustee.ietf.org/license-info).

VirtualMachineIndex.name: VirtualMachineIndex
VirtualMachineIndex.description: A unique value, greater than zero, identifying a virtual machine. The value for each virtual machine MUST remain constant at least from one re-initialization of the hypervisor to the next re-initialization.

VirtualMachineIndexOrZero.name: VirtualMachineIndexOrZero
VirtualMachineIndexOrZero.description: This textual convention is an extension of the VirtualMachineIndex convention. This extension permits the additional value of zero. The meaning of the value zero is object-specific and MUST therefore be defined as part of the description of any object that uses this syntax. Examples of the usage of zero might include situations where a virtual machine is unknown, or when none or all virtual machines need to be referenced.

VirtualMachineAdminState.name: VirtualMachineAdminState
VirtualMachineAdminState.description: The administrative state of a virtual machine: running(1) The administrative state of the virtual machine indicating the virtual machine is currently online or should be brought online. suspended(2) The administrative state of the virtual machine where its memory and CPU execution state has been saved to persistent store and will be restored at next running(1). paused(3) The administrative state indicating the virtual machine is resident in memory but is no longer scheduled to execute by the hypervisor. shutdown(4) The administrative state of the virtual machine indicating the virtual machine is currently offline or should be shutting down.

VirtualMachineOperState.name: VirtualMachineOperState
VirtualMachineOperState.description: The operational state of a virtual machine: unknown(1) The operational state of the virtual machine is unknown, e.g., because the implementation failed to obtain the state from the hypervisor. other(2) The operational state of the virtual machine indicating that an operational state is obtained from the hypervisor, but it is not a state defined in this MIB module. preparing(3) The operational state of the virtual machine indicating the virtual machine is currently in the process of preparation, e.g., allocating and initializing virtual storage after creating (defining) the virtual machine. running(4) The operational state of the virtual machine indicating the virtual machine is currently executed, but it is not in the process of preparing(3), suspending(5), resuming(7), migrating(9), and shuttingdown(10). suspending(5) The operational state of the virtual machine indicating the virtual machine is currently in the process of suspending to save its memory and CPU execution state to persistent store. This is a transient state from running(4) to suspended(6). suspended(6) The operational state of the virtual machine indicating the virtual machine is currently suspended, which means the memory and CPU execution state of the virtual machine are saved to persistent store. During this state, the virtual machine is not scheduled to execute by the hypervisor. resuming(7) The operational state of the virtual machine indicating the virtual machine is currently in the process of resuming to restore its memory and CPU execution state from persistent store. This is a transient state from suspended(6) to running(4). paused(8) The operational state of the virtual machine indicating the virtual machine is resident in memory but no longer scheduled to execute by the hypervisor. migrating(9) The operational state of the virtual machine indicating the virtual machine is currently in the process of migration from/to another hypervisor. shuttingdown(10) The operational state of the virtual machine indicating the virtual machine is currently in the process of shutting down. This is a transient state from running(4) to shutdown(11). shutdown(11) The operational state of the virtual machine indicating the virtual machine is down, and CPU execution is no longer scheduled by the hypervisor and its memory is not resident in the hypervisor. crashed(12) The operational state of the virtual machine indicating the virtual machine has crashed.

VirtualMachineAutoStart.name: VirtualMachineAutoStart
VirtualMachineAutoStart.description: The autostart configuration of a virtual machine: unknown(1) The autostart configuration is unknown, e.g., because the implementation failed to obtain the autostart configuration from the hypervisor. enabled(2) The autostart configuration of the virtual machine is enabled. The virtual machine should be automatically brought online at the next re-initialization of the hypervisor. disabled(3) The autostart configuration of the virtual machine is disabled. The virtual machine should not be automatically brought online at the next re-initialization of the hypervisor.

VirtualMachinePersistent.name: VirtualMachinePersistent
VirtualMachinePersistent.description: This value indicates whether a virtual machine has a persistent configuration, which means the virtual machine will still exist after shutting down: unknown(1) The persistent configuration is unknown, e.g., because the implementation failed to obtain the persistent configuration from the hypervisor. (read-only) persistent(2) The virtual machine is persistent, i.e., the virtual machine will exist after it shuts down. transient(3) The virtual machine is transient, i.e., the virtual machine will not exist after it shuts down.

VirtualMachineCpuIndex.name: VirtualMachineCpuIndex
VirtualMachineCpuIndex.description: A unique value for each virtual machine, greater than zero, identifying a virtual CPU assigned to a virtual machine. The value for each virtual CPU MUST remain constant at least from one re-initialization of the hypervisor to the next re-initialization.

VirtualMachineStorageIndex.name: VirtualMachineStorageIndex
VirtualMachineStorageIndex.description: A unique value for each virtual machine, greater than zero, identifying a virtual storage device allocated to a virtual machine. The value for each virtual storage device MUST remain constant at least from one re-initialization of the hypervisor to the next re-initialization.

VirtualMachineStorageSourceType.name: VirtualMachineStorageSourceType
VirtualMachineStorageSourceType.description: The source type of a virtual storage device: unknown(1) The source type is unknown, e.g., because the implementation failed to obtain the media type from the hypervisor. other(2) The source type is other than those defined in this conversion. block(3) The source type is a block device. raw(4) The source type is a raw-formatted file. sparse(5) The source type is a sparse file. network(6) The source type is a network device.

VirtualMachineStorageAccess.name: VirtualMachineStorageAccess
VirtualMachineStorageAccess.description: The access permission of a virtual storage: unknown(1) The access permission of the virtual storage is unknown. readwrite(2) The virtual storage is a read-write device. readonly(3) The virtual storage is a read-only device.

VirtualMachineNetworkIndex.name: VirtualMachineNetworkIndex
VirtualMachineNetworkIndex.description: A unique value for each virtual machine, greater than zero, identifying a virtual network interface allocated to the virtual machine. The value for each virtual network interface MUST remain constant at least from one re-initialization of the hypervisor to the next re-initialization.

VirtualMachineList.name: VirtualMachineList
VirtualMachineList.description: Each octet within this value specifies a set of eight virtual machine vmIndex values, with the first octet specifying virtual machine 1 through 8, the second octet specifying virtual machine 9 through 16, etc. Within each octet, the most significant bit represents the lowest-numbered vmIndex, and the least significant bit represents the highest-numbered vmIndex. Thus, each virtual machine of the host is represented by a single bit within the value of this object. If that bit has a value of '1', then that virtual machine is included in the set of virtual machines; the virtual machine is not included if its bit has a value of '0'.

vmHvSoftware.name: vmHvSoftware
vmHvSoftware.description: A textual description of the hypervisor software. This value SHOULD NOT include its version as it SHOULD be included in 'vmHvVersion'.

vmHvVersion.name: vmHvVersion
vmHvVersion.description: A textual description of the version of the hypervisor software.

vmHvObjectID.name: vmHvObjectID
vmHvObjectID.description: The vendor's authoritative identification of the hypervisor software contained in the entity. This value is allocated within the SMI enterprises subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1). Note that this is different from sysObjectID in the SNMPv2-MIB (RFC 3418) because sysObjectID is not the identification of the hypervisor software but the device, firmware, or management operating system.

vmHvUpTime.name: vmHvUpTime
vmHvUpTime.description: The time (in centiseconds) since the hypervisor was last re-initialized. Note that this is different from sysUpTime in the SNMPv2-MIB (RFC 3418) and hrSystemUptime in the HOST-RESOURCES-MIB (RFC 2790) because sysUpTime is the uptime of the network management portion of the system, and hrSystemUptime is the uptime of the management operating system but not the hypervisor software.

vmNumber.name: vmNumber
vmNumber.description: The number of virtual machines (regardless of their current state) present on this hypervisor.

vmTableLastChange.name: vmTableLastChange
vmTableLastChange.description: The value of vmHvUpTime at the time of the last creation or deletion of an entry in the vmTable.

vmTable.name: vmTable
vmTable.description: A list of virtual machine entries. The number of entries is given by the value of vmNumber.

vmEntry.name: vmEntry
vmEntry.description: An entry containing management information applicable to a particular virtual machine.

vmIndex.name: vmIndex
vmIndex.description: A unique value, greater than zero, identifying the virtual machine. The value assigned to a given virtual machine may not persist across re-initialization of the hypervisor. A command generator MUST use the vmUUID to identify a given virtual machine of interest.

vmName.name: vmName
vmName.description: A textual name of the virtual machine.

vmUUID.name: vmUUID
vmUUID.description: The virtual machine's 128-bit Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) or the zero-length string when a UUID is not available. If set, the UUID MUST uniquely identify a virtual machine from all other virtual machines in an administrative domain. A zero-length octet string is returned if no UUID information is known.

vmOSType.name: vmOSType
vmOSType.description: A textual description containing operating system information installed on the virtual machine. This value corresponds to the operating system the hypervisor assumes to be running when the virtual machine is started. This may differ from the actual operating system in case the virtual machine boots into a different operating system.

vmAdminState.name: vmAdminState
vmAdminState.description: The administrative state of the virtual machine.

vmOperState.name: vmOperState
vmOperState.description: The operational state of the virtual machine.

vmAutoStart.name: vmAutoStart
vmAutoStart.description: The autostart configuration of the virtual machine. If this value is enable(2), the virtual machine automatically starts at the next initialization of the hypervisor.

vmPersistent.name: vmPersistent
vmPersistent.description: This value indicates whether the virtual machine has a persistent configuration, which means the virtual machine will still exist after its shutdown.

vmCurCpuNumber.name: vmCurCpuNumber
vmCurCpuNumber.description: The number of virtual CPUs currently assigned to the virtual machine.

vmMinCpuNumber.name: vmMinCpuNumber
vmMinCpuNumber.description: The minimum number of virtual CPUs that are assigned to the virtual machine when it is in a power-on state. The value -1 indicates that there is no hard boundary for the minimum number of virtual CPUs.

vmMaxCpuNumber.name: vmMaxCpuNumber
vmMaxCpuNumber.description: The maximum number of virtual CPUs that are assigned to the virtual machine when it is in a power-on state. The value -1 indicates that there is no limit.

vmMemUnit.name: vmMemUnit
vmMemUnit.description: The multiplication unit in bytes for vmCurMem, vmMinMem, and vmMaxMem. For example, when this value is 1024, the memory size unit for vmCurMem, vmMinMem, and vmMaxMem is KiB.

vmCurMem.name: vmCurMem
vmCurMem.description: The current memory size currently allocated to the virtual memory module in the unit designated by vmMemUnit.

vmMinMem.name: vmMinMem
vmMinMem.description: The minimum memory size defined to the virtual machine in the unit designated by vmMemUnit. The value -1 indicates that there is no hard boundary for the minimum memory size.

vmMaxMem.name: vmMaxMem
vmMaxMem.description: The maximum memory size defined to the virtual machine in the unit designated by vmMemUnit. The value -1 indicates that there is no limit.

vmUpTime.name: vmUpTime
vmUpTime.description: The time (in centiseconds) since the administrative state of the virtual machine was last changed from shutdown(4) to running(1).

vmCpuTime.name: vmCpuTime
vmCpuTime.description: The total CPU time used in microseconds. If the number of virtual CPUs is larger than 1, vmCpuTime may exceed real time. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the hypervisor and administrative state (vmAdminState) changes of the virtual machine.

vmCpuTable.name: vmCpuTable
vmCpuTable.description: The table of virtual CPUs provided by the hypervisor.

vmCpuEntry.name: vmCpuEntry
vmCpuEntry.description: An entry for one virtual processor assigned to a virtual machine.

vmCpuIndex.name: vmCpuIndex
vmCpuIndex.description: A unique value identifying a virtual CPU assigned to the virtual machine.

vmCpuCoreTime.name: vmCpuCoreTime
vmCpuCoreTime.description: The total CPU time used by this virtual CPU in microseconds. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the hypervisor and administrative state (vmAdminState) changes of the virtual machine.

vmCpuAffinityTable.name: vmCpuAffinityTable
vmCpuAffinityTable.description: A list of CPU affinity entries of a virtual CPU.

vmCpuAffinityEntry.name: vmCpuAffinityEntry
vmCpuAffinityEntry.description: An entry containing CPU affinity associated with a particular virtual machine.

vmCpuPhysIndex.name: vmCpuPhysIndex
vmCpuPhysIndex.description: A value identifying a physical CPU on the hypervisor. On systems implementing the HOST-RESOURCES-MIB, the value MUST be the same value that is used as the index in the hrProcessorTable (hrDeviceIndex).

vmCpuAffinity.name: vmCpuAffinity
vmCpuAffinity.description: The CPU affinity of this virtual CPU to the physical CPU represented by 'vmCpuPhysIndex'.

vmStorageTable.name: vmStorageTable
vmStorageTable.description: The conceptual table of virtual storage devices attached to the virtual machine.

vmStorageEntry.name: vmStorageEntry
vmStorageEntry.description: An entry for one virtual storage device attached to the virtual machine.

vmStorageVmIndex.name: vmStorageVmIndex
vmStorageVmIndex.description: This value identifies the virtual machine (guest) this storage device has been allocated to. The value zero indicates that the storage device is currently not allocated to any virtual machines.

vmStorageIndex.name: vmStorageIndex
vmStorageIndex.description: A unique value identifying a virtual storage device allocated to the virtual machine.

vmStorageParent.name: vmStorageParent
vmStorageParent.description: The value of hrStorageIndex, which is the parent (i.e., physical) device of this virtual device on systems implementing the HOST-RESOURCES-MIB. The value zero denotes this virtual device is not any child represented in the hrStorageTable.

vmStorageSourceType.name: vmStorageSourceType
vmStorageSourceType.description: The source type of the virtual storage device.

vmStorageSourceTypeString.name: vmStorageSourceTypeString
vmStorageSourceTypeString.description: A (detailed) textual string of the source type of the virtual storage device. For example, this represents the specific format name of the sparse file.

vmStorageResourceID.name: vmStorageResourceID
vmStorageResourceID.description: A textual string that represents the resource identifier of the virtual storage. For example, this contains the path to the disk image file that corresponds to the virtual storage.

vmStorageAccess.name: vmStorageAccess
vmStorageAccess.description: The access permission of the virtual storage device.

vmStorageMediaType.name: vmStorageMediaType
vmStorageMediaType.description: The media type of the virtual storage device.

vmStorageMediaTypeString.name: vmStorageMediaTypeString
vmStorageMediaTypeString.description: A (detailed) textual string of the virtual storage media. For example, this represents the specific driver name of the emulated media such as 'IDE' and 'SCSI'.

vmStorageSizeUnit.name: vmStorageSizeUnit
vmStorageSizeUnit.description: The multiplication unit in bytes for vmStorageDefinedSize and vmStorageAllocatedSize. For example, when this value is 1048576, the storage size unit for vmStorageDefinedSize and vmStorageAllocatedSize is MiB.

vmStorageDefinedSize.name: vmStorageDefinedSize
vmStorageDefinedSize.description: The defined virtual storage size defined in the unit designated by vmStorageSizeUnit. If this information is not available, this value MUST be -1.

vmStorageAllocatedSize.name: vmStorageAllocatedSize
vmStorageAllocatedSize.description: The storage size allocated to the virtual storage from a physical storage in the unit designated by vmStorageSizeUnit. When the virtual storage is block device or raw file, this value and vmStorageDefinedSize are supposed to equal. This value MUST NOT be different from vmStorageDefinedSize when vmStorageSourceType is 'block' or 'raw'. If this information is not available, this value MUST be -1.

vmStorageReadIOs.name: vmStorageReadIOs
vmStorageReadIOs.description: The number of read I/O requests. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the hypervisor and administrative state (vmAdminState) changes of the virtual machine.

vmStorageWriteIOs.name: vmStorageWriteIOs
vmStorageWriteIOs.description: The number of write I/O requests. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the hypervisor and administrative state (vmAdminState) changes of the virtual machine.

vmStorageReadOctets.name: vmStorageReadOctets
vmStorageReadOctets.description: The total number of bytes read from this device. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the hypervisor and administrative state (vmAdminState) changes of the virtual machine.

vmStorageWriteOctets.name: vmStorageWriteOctets
vmStorageWriteOctets.description: The total number of bytes written to this device. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the hypervisor and administrative state (vmAdminState) changes of the virtual machine.

vmStorageReadLatency.name: vmStorageReadLatency
vmStorageReadLatency.description: The total number of microseconds read requests have been queued for this device. This would typically be implemented by storing the high precision system timestamp of when the request is received from the virtual machine with the request, the difference between this initial timestamp and the time at which the requested operation has completed SHOULD be converted to microseconds and accumulated. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the hypervisor and administrative state (vmAdminState) changes of the virtual machine.

vmStorageWriteLatency.name: vmStorageWriteLatency
vmStorageWriteLatency.description: The total number of microseconds write requests have been queued for this device. This would typically be implemented by storing the high precision system timestamp of when the request is received from the virtual machine with the request; the difference between this initial timestamp and the time at which the requested operation has completed SHOULD be converted to microseconds and accumulated. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the hypervisor and administrative state (vmAdminState) changes of the virtual machine.

vmNetworkTable.name: vmNetworkTable
vmNetworkTable.description: The conceptual table of virtual network interfaces attached to the virtual machine.

vmNetworkEntry.name: vmNetworkEntry
vmNetworkEntry.description: An entry for one virtual network interface attached to the virtual machine.

vmNetworkIndex.name: vmNetworkIndex
vmNetworkIndex.description: A unique value identifying a virtual network interface allocated to the virtual machine.

vmNetworkIfIndex.name: vmNetworkIfIndex
vmNetworkIfIndex.description: The value of ifIndex, which corresponds to this virtual network interface. If this device is not represented in the ifTable, then this value MUST be zero.

vmNetworkParent.name: vmNetworkParent
vmNetworkParent.description: The value of ifIndex, which corresponds to the parent (i.e., physical) device of this virtual device. The value zero denotes this virtual device is not any child represented in the ifTable.

vmNetworkModel.name: vmNetworkModel
vmNetworkModel.description: A textual string containing the (emulated) model of the virtual network interface. For example, this value is 'virtio' when the emulation driver model is virtio.

vmNetworkPhysAddress.name: vmNetworkPhysAddress
vmNetworkPhysAddress.description: The Media Access Control (MAC) address of the virtual network interface.

vmPerVMNotificationsEnabled.name: vmPerVMNotificationsEnabled
vmPerVMNotificationsEnabled.description: Indicates if the notification generator will send notifications per virtual machine. Changes to this object MUST NOT persist across re-initialization of the management system, e.g., SNMP agent.

vmBulkNotificationsEnabled.name: vmBulkNotificationsEnabled
vmBulkNotificationsEnabled.description: Indicates if the notification generator will send notifications per set of virtual machines. Changes to this object MUST NOT persist across re-initialization of the management system, e.g., SNMP agent.

vmAffectedVMs.name: vmAffectedVMs
vmAffectedVMs.description: A complete list of virtual machines whose state has changed. This object is the only object sent with bulk notifications.

vmRunning.name: vmRunning
vmRunning.description: This notification is generated when the operational state of a virtual machine has been changed to running(4) from some other state. The other state is indicated by the included value of vmOperState.

vmShuttingdown.name: vmShuttingdown
vmShuttingdown.description: This notification is generated when the operational state of a virtual machine has been changed to shuttingdown(10) from some other state. The other state is indicated by the included value of vmOperState.

vmShutdown.name: vmShutdown
vmShutdown.description: This notification is generated when the operational state of a virtual machine has been changed to shutdown(11) from some other state. The other state is indicated by the included value of vmOperState.

vmPaused.name: vmPaused
vmPaused.description: This notification is generated when the operational state of a virtual machine has been changed to paused(8) from some other state. The other state is indicated by the included value of vmOperState.

vmSuspending.name: vmSuspending
vmSuspending.description: This notification is generated when the operational state of a virtual machine has been changed to suspending(5) from some other state. The other state is indicated by the included value of vmOperState.

vmSuspended.name: vmSuspended
vmSuspended.description: This notification is generated when the operational state of a virtual machine has been changed to suspended(6) from some other state. The other state is indicated by the included value of vmOperState.

vmResuming.name: vmResuming
vmResuming.description: This notification is generated when the operational state of a virtual machine has been changed to resuming(7) from some other state. The other state is indicated by the included value of vmOperState.

vmMigrating.name: vmMigrating
vmMigrating.description: This notification is generated when the operational state of a virtual machine has been changed to migrating(9) from some other state. The other state is indicated by the included value of vmOperState.

vmCrashed.name: vmCrashed
vmCrashed.description: This notification is generated when a virtual machine has been crashed. The previous state of the virtual machine is indicated by the included value of vmOperState.

vmDeleted.name: vmDeleted
vmDeleted.description: This notification is generated when a virtual machine has been deleted. The prior state of the virtual machine is indicated by the included value of vmOperState.

vmBulkRunning.name: vmBulkRunning
vmBulkRunning.description: This notification is generated when the operational state of one or more virtual machines has been changed to running(4) from any prior state, except for running(4). Management stations are encouraged to subsequently poll the subset of virtual machines of interest for vmOperState.

vmBulkShuttingdown.name: vmBulkShuttingdown
vmBulkShuttingdown.description: This notification is generated when the operational state of one or more virtual machines has been changed to shuttingdown(10) from a state other than shuttingdown(10). Management stations are encouraged to subsequently poll the subset of virtual machines of interest for vmOperState.

vmBulkShutdown.name: vmBulkShutdown
vmBulkShutdown.description: This notification is generated when the operational state of one or more virtual machine has been changed to shutdown(11) from a state other than shutdown(11). Management stations are encouraged to subsequently poll the subset of virtual machines of interest for vmOperState.

vmBulkPaused.name: vmBulkPaused
vmBulkPaused.description: This notification is generated when the operational state of one or more virtual machines has been changed to paused(8) from a state other than paused(8). Management stations are encouraged to subsequently poll the subset of virtual machines of interest for vmOperState.

vmBulkSuspending.name: vmBulkSuspending
vmBulkSuspending.description: This notification is generated when the operational state of one or more virtual machines has been changed to suspending(5) from a state other than suspending(5). Management stations are encouraged to subsequently poll the subset of virtual machines of interest for vmOperState.

vmBulkSuspended.name: vmBulkSuspended
vmBulkSuspended.description: This notification is generated when the operational state of one or more virtual machines has been changed to suspended(6) from a state other than suspended(6). Management stations are encouraged to subsequently poll the subset of virtual machines of interest for vmOperState.

vmBulkResuming.name: vmBulkResuming
vmBulkResuming.description: This notification is generated when the operational state of one or more virtual machines has been changed to resuming(7) from a state other than resuming(7). Management stations are encouraged to subsequently poll the subset of virtual machines of interest for vmOperState.

vmBulkMigrating.name: vmBulkMigrating
vmBulkMigrating.description: This notification is generated when the operational state of one or more virtual machines has been changed to migrating(9) from a state other than migrating(9). Management stations are encouraged to subsequently poll the subset of virtual machines of interest for vmOperState.

vmBulkCrashed.name: vmBulkCrashed
vmBulkCrashed.description: This notification is generated when one or more virtual machines have been crashed. Management stations are encouraged to subsequently poll the subset of virtual machines of interest for vmOperState.

vmBulkDeleted.name: vmBulkDeleted
vmBulkDeleted.description: This notification is generated when one or more virtual machines have been deleted. Management stations are encouraged to subsequently poll the subset of virtual machines of interest for vmOperState.

vmFullCompliances.name: vmFullCompliances
vmFullCompliances.description: Compliance statement for implementations supporting read/write access, according to the object definitions.

vmReadOnlyCompliances.name: vmReadOnlyCompliances
vmReadOnlyCompliances.description: Compliance statement for implementations supporting only read-only access.

vmHypervisorGroup.name: vmHypervisorGroup
vmHypervisorGroup.description: A collection of objects providing insight into the hypervisor itself.

vmVirtualMachineGroup.name: vmVirtualMachineGroup
vmVirtualMachineGroup.description: A collection of objects providing insight into the virtual machines controlled by a hypervisor.

vmCpuGroup.name: vmCpuGroup
vmCpuGroup.description: A collection of objects providing insight into the virtual machines controlled by a hypervisor.

vmCpuAffinityGroup.name: vmCpuAffinityGroup
vmCpuAffinityGroup.description: A collection of objects providing insight into the virtual machines controlled by a hypervisor.

vmStorageGroup.name: vmStorageGroup
vmStorageGroup.description: A collection of objects providing insight into the virtual storage devices controlled by a hypervisor.

vmNetworkGroup.name: vmNetworkGroup
vmNetworkGroup.description: A collection of objects providing insight into the virtual network interfaces controlled by a hypervisor.

vmPerVMNotificationOptionalGroup.name: vmPerVMNotificationOptionalGroup
vmPerVMNotificationOptionalGroup.description: A collection of notifications for per-VM notification of changes to virtual machine state (vmOperState) as reported by a hypervisor.

vmBulkNotificationsVariablesGroup.name: vmBulkNotificationsVariablesGroup
vmBulkNotificationsVariablesGroup.description: The variables used in vmBulkNotificationOptionalGroup virtual network interfaces controlled by a hypervisor.

vmBulkNotificationOptionalGroup.name: vmBulkNotificationOptionalGroup
vmBulkNotificationOptionalGroup.description: A collection of notifications for bulk notification of changes to virtual machine state (vmOperState) as reported by a given hypervisor.
